intro: Icacorea polydactyla, commonly known as the coastal hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. Icacorea polydactyla is adapted to saline and sandy soils, making it a hardy species found in coastal ecosystems.
